abstracts.cdata!:
In the aftermath of Ecuador's
            recent earthquake, the primary objective of the proposed
            project is to urgently restore oil production and export
            flows. In addition, the project plans to help (i) minimize
            the environmental impact of the disaster and related
            reconstruction programs; (ii) enhance the National Oil
            Company's (CEPE) capacity to deal with the crisis and
            its aftermath; and (iii) enhance the Government's
            preparedness to deal with future national emergencies.  To
            this end, the proposed project consists of:  (i) equipment
            and civil works related to the reconstruction of the
            Trans-Ecuadorian crude oil and liquid petroleum gas (LPG)
            pipelines; (ii) well-workovers and
            rehabilitation/maintenance works required to avoid long-term
            damage to the oil fields due to the interruption of
            production and (iii) oil field development to boost oil
            extraction to a level of about 320,000 B/D by the end-1987
            in order to recoup lost production.  Finally, the project
            entails (iv) technical assistance, including engineering,
            management and inspection services, and consultants to
            prepare a plan for the management of future national emergencies.
